intro: Chaetaria teneriffae, commonly known as the Canary Islands hairgrass, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, showing a high degree of adaptability to harsh environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and it produces lightweight seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
